intro: Schmidelia rhomboidalis, commonly known as the rhomboid leaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, rhomboid-shaped leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Schmidelia rhomboidalis is often found in the Carolinas and Florida, where it thrives in humid, temperate climates.
